content.description:
Starts about 150 ft to the right and up from the “Dope fiend’s dike”.  You will be able to see the  “S Crack”  from a distance.  

 Layback the finger crack until it opens up to a 5 and 6 inch flake with chickenheads and plates on both sides.   Pull over the flake and ride it like a Pony. The next section has a bit more hand cracks to a .10 a section and glory chickenheads. Pull over bulge and follow left leaning hand crack on low angle rock and belay at the top.

 Rappel from chickenheads or trees or find big chimney system to downclimb to the NE or towards Entrance dome/ wasteland.
content.location: 5 minutes from the Dope fiend’s dike

content.description:
Partner and I climbed this formation following its steepest aspects and staying on the buttress for the majority of the route until you can traverse and freestyle over to the summit.

 Pitch 1 - 3rd class to the start of a long wide crack 

 Pitch 2 - Larger gear useful but not necessary (.8)

 Pitch 3 - move belay 150 ft down gully 

 Pitch 4 - Huge dike and cracks  (.10)

 Pitch 5 - splitter fingers and A0 pendulum.  (10+)

 Pitch 6 - 180 ft of scrambling 

 Pitch 7 - Either go around or up steep plates (.9/10)
content.protection: Standard rack up to #3    One or two rappels as you scramble down. One rope
content.location: Hike and bushwhack for a good start

climbs.name: Dope Fiend’s Dike to Pacifico crack

content.description:
Start on low angle ramp on the right side of ledge system. Go up and climb cracks to bulge and giant Dike that goes up and left. (.9)

 Pitch 2  Keep following the dike until it eventually becomes a massive chickenhead.

Keep going another 30 or more feet to reach the “Dino Arena”.  

This is a large see through Arch that you can’t see until you are under it.  (.8)

 Pitch 3 - Climb elegant crack system under the Arch. Hand jams and laybacking takes you to the top of the Arena. (.10ab)

 Descent: Down climb chimney on NE side or rappel off chickenheads
content.location: Go to the Hurt Butt Saddle where it joins the Wasteland and Entrance dome drainage and you will see the rocks.

content.description: Big sunny formation seen across from Rockfellow group and second highest summit in the Stronghold itself.   There are numerous ways to reach the summit and route finding can be tricky. Pick and choose your adventure on this one
